intro: Eleocharis montevidensis var. decumbens, commonly known as the匍匐莎草, is a sedge species native to South America. It typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is characterized by its decumbent growth habit, where the stems lie flat on the ground. This variety is often found in nutrient-rich soils and plays a role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems.
